verses.plain: Blessed is he that considereth the poor: the LORD will deliver him in time of trouble.

tokens.t: Blessed
he that considereth the poor: the
will deliver him in time of trouble.

verses.plain: The LORD will preserve him, and keep him alive; and he shall be blessed upon the earth: and thou wilt not deliver him unto the will of his enemies.

tokens.t: The
will preserve him, and keep him alive;
he shall be blessed upon the earth: and thou wilt not deliver him unto the will of his enemies.

verses.plain: The LORD will strengthen him upon the bed of languishing: thou wilt make all his bed in his sickness.

tokens.t: The
will strengthen him upon the bed of languishing: thou wilt make all his bed in his sickness.

verses.plain: I said, LORD, be merciful unto me: heal my soul; for I have sinned against thee.

tokens.t: I said,
, be merciful unto me: heal my soul; for I have sinned against thee.

verses.plain: Mine enemies speak evil of me, When shall he die, and his name perish?

tokens.t: Mine enemies speak evil of me, When shall he die, and his name perish?

verses.plain: And if he come to see me, he speaketh vanity: his heart gathereth iniquity to itself; when he goeth abroad, he telleth it.

tokens.t: And if he come to see
, he speaketh vanity: his heart gathereth iniquity to itself;
he goeth abroad, he telleth

verses.plain: All that hate me whisper together against me: against me do they devise my hurt.

tokens.t: All that hate me whisper together against me: against me do they devise my hurt.

verses.plain: An evil disease, say they, cleaveth fast unto him: and now that he lieth he shall rise up no more.

tokens.t: An evil disease,
, cleaveth fast unto him: and
that he lieth he shall rise up no more.

verses.plain: Yea, mine own familiar friend, in whom I trusted, which did eat of my bread, hath lifted up his heel against me.

tokens.t: Yea, mine own familiar friend, in whom I trusted, which did eat of my bread, hath lifted up
heel against me.

verses.plain: But thou, O LORD, be merciful unto me, and raise me up, that I may requite them.

tokens.t: But thou, O
, be merciful unto me, and raise me up, that I may requite them.

verses.plain: By this I know that thou favourest me, because mine enemy doth not triumph over me.

tokens.t: By this I know that thou favourest me, because mine enemy doth not triumph over me.

verses.plain: And as for me, thou upholdest me in mine integrity, and settest me before thy face for ever.

tokens.t: And as for me, thou upholdest me in mine integrity, and settest me before thy face for ever.

verses.plain: Blessed be the LORD God of Israel from everlasting, and to everlasting. Amen, and Amen.

tokens.t: Blessed
the
God of Israel from everlasting, and to everlasting. Amen, and Amen.

footnotes.text: the poor: or, the weak, or, sick
in time…: Heb. in the day of evil
thou…: or, do not thou deliver
An…: Heb. A thing of Belial
mine…: Heb. the man of my peace
